item.title: Report E-2024100398
item.description:
Report E-2024100398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: GILBERT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BARNES OIL AND PROPANE INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On October 15th 2024 between the hours of 13:00 and 14:00 the driver loaded 7,500 gallons of clear diesel fuel into truck number 60, trailer number 139 at the Kinder Morgan fuel Terminal in North Augusta, SC. The driver left Kinder Morgan headed towards Columbia on I-20 and got off the interstate on exit 22 which is HWY #1. The driver traveled down #1 Hwy until he got to Chinquapin Road in Monetta and turned right. Chinquapin Rd turned into Two Notch Road which is in Leesville SC. The driver made a right turn onto Pond Branch and proceeded towards exit 44. The driver came over the bridge slowing down so that he would be able to make the turn. The driver stated he didnâ€™t feel like he was speeding making the turn, but he never looked at the speedometer. The driver made his turn, and the truck proceeded to lay over on its side. The Lexington County Fire Service responded to the scene. The rollover resulted in approximately 1500 gallons of ULSD being released on to the ground. The spilt fuel was recovered/remediated by Republic Services. The remaining product was pumped from the rolled over trailer to a trailer brought on scene by Barnes Oil & Propane Representatives.

item.title: Report E-2024100382
item.description:
Report E-2024100382

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: DUNCAN
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a routine vehicle inspection at the job site, Veolia employees discovered paint dripping from a drum. Upon investigation, they determined that the leaking drum had been collected from a previous customer, Hentzen. The employees located the source of the leak, which was coming from the top of the drum. After a thorough inspection, the seal was identified as the cause of the problem. The employees theorized that the truck's vibration during transport had caused the paint to seep through the faulty top seal. Fortunately, the spill was contained within the truck, and no paint had leaked outside while the vehicle was in motion. The team took immediate action to address the situation. They contained the spill and overpacked the drum, along with all materials used in the cleanup process. This prompt response ensured that the incident was managed efficiently and safely, minimizing any potential environmental impact or further complications.

item.title: Report E-2024090490
item.description:
Report E-2024090490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: Charleston
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/20/2024, at 0857 hours, CSX personnel reported UTLX 208840, a loaded tank car containing Alcohols, N.O.S., leaking from top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Poet Bioprocessing, was notified via Ambipar (Report #20240920-01-02787). CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials Rob James responded to the scene and found five of eight manway cover bolts less than tool tight. Mr. James inspected the car to ensure there were no notable defects to the manway cover, gasket, or nozzle, and secured all manway cover bolts tool tight to secure the product release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Jared Ayers (316-213-2805). Upon proper securement the car was released for transportation.
